tool.name: Microbiome Multivariable Association with Linear Models
tool.command: mkdir maaslin_output && Rscript /galaxy-central/tools/maaslin/Maaslin2/R/Maaslin2.R $taxonomy $metadata maaslin_output #if $str($gchoice_additional_analysis_types.global_additional_analysis_types) == "1": -a $gchoice_additional_analysis_types.MIN_ABUNDANCE -p $gchoice_additional_analysis_types.MIN_PREVALENCE -b $gchoice_additional_analysis_types.MIN_VARIANCE -n $gchoice_additional_analysis_types.NORMALIZATION -t $gchoice_additional_analysis_types.TRANSFORM -m $gchoice_additional_analysis_types.ANALYSIS_METHOD -c $gchoice_additional_analysis_types.CORRECTION -i $gchoice_additional_analysis_types.HEATMAP_FIRST_N -g $gchoice_additional_analysis_types.MAX_PNGS #end if --transform=AST --fixed_effects="diagnosis,dysbiosisnonIBD;dysbiosisUC,dysbiosisCD;antibiotics,age" --random_effects="site,subject" --normalization=NONE --standardize=FALSE --reference="diagnosis,nonIBD" && cp Rplots.pdf $output1 && zip -r Maaslin2_Results.zip maaslin_output && cp Maaslin2_Results.zip $output2 && rm -r maaslin_output && rm Rplots.pdf

param.name: global_additional_analysis_types
param.label: Display additional analysis types and arguments advanced parameters
param.help: Select additional analysis types and argument advanced choices

param.name: MIN_PREVALENCE
param.label: The minimum percent of samples for which a feature is detected at minimum abundance

param.name: MIN_VARIANCE
param.label: Keep features with variances greater than value

param.name: CORRECTION
param.label: The correction method for computing the q-value

param.name: HEATMAP_FIRST_N
param.label: In heatmap, plot top N features with significant associations

param.name: MAX_PNGS
param.label: The maximum number of scatterplots for signficant associations to save as png files

data.name: output2
data.label: MaAsLin Output zip results - please download

tool.help:
.. _Maaslin2: https://github.com/biobakery/Maaslin2/ .. _Maaslin_Article: https://doi.org/10.1101/2021.01.20.427420
MaAsLin2 provides a comprehensive multi-model system for performing multivariable association testing in microbiome profiles, taxonomic, functional, or metabolomic - with analysis modules for preprocessing, normalization, transformation, and data-driven statistical modeling to tackle the challenges of microbial multi-omics (compositionality, overdispersion, zero-inflation, variable library size and high-dimensionality.
**Inputs** ==========
The MaAsLin 2 implementation requires two inputs:
* Microbial feature abundances (e.g. taxa, genes, transcripts, or metabolites) across samples, in either counts or relative counts * Environmental, clinical, or epidemiological phenotypes or covariates of interest (together “metadata”).
.. _Sample_Metadata: https://github.com/biobakery/Maaslin2/blob/master/inst/extdata/HMP2_metadata.tsv
.. _Sample_Taxonomy: https://github.com/biobakery/Maaslin2/blob/master/inst/extdata/HMP2_taxonomy.tsv
**Sample Data** ===============
You can download sample data to your computer from the following locations and then upload it to Galaxy using the Get-Data / Upload file from your computer.
* Sample_Metadata_
* Sample_Taxonomy_
.. _Maaslin_Tutorial: https://github.com/biobakery/biobakery/wiki/maaslin2 .. _Maaslin_User_Manual: https://github.com/biobakery/Maaslin2 .. _Maaslin_User_Forum: https://forum.biobakery.org/c/Downstream-analysis-and-statistics/MaAsLin/10
